content.webTitle: Letters: Making it like a man

fields.headline: Making it like a man
fields.bodyText: Let me get this straight: Kate Moss is worthy of the same kind of commendation as the McCartney sisters, Marla Ruzicka, Rosa Parks, Mukhtaran Bibi and Rania al-Baz (Those we have loved, G2, December 16)? Because she lives a completely selfish lifestyle and lives recklessly in the pursuit of hedonistic pleasures? Because if she were a man people might look at it differently? How about, instead of saying "oh, good for you Kate - you too can be a money-grubbing, selfish, irresponsible, antisocial 'success' just like a man", we look at why we think it's OK for so many men to get away with this kind of behaviour. Being able to be equally antisocial to men is not progress. Maria Blum Birmingham
